options.title: -a, --all
options.description: do not ignore entries starting with .

options.title: -a, --all
options.description: do not ignore entries starting with .

options.title: -A, --almost-all
options.description: do not list implied . and ..

options.title: -A, --almost-all
options.description: do not list implied . and ..

options.title: --author
options.description: with -l, print the author of each file

options.title: -b, --escape
options.description: print C-style escapes for nongraphic characters

options.title: -b, --escape
options.description: print C-style escapes for nongraphic characters

options.title: --block-size=SIZE
options.description: with -l, scale sizes by SIZE when printing them; e.g., '--block-size=M'; see SIZE format below

options.title: -B, --ignore-backups
options.description: do not list implied entries ending with ~

options.title: -B, --ignore-backups
options.description: do not list implied entries ending with ~

options.title: -c
options.description: with -lt: sort by, and show, ctime (time of last modification of file status information); with -l: show ctime and sort by name; otherwise: sort by ctime, newest first

options.title: -C
options.description: list entries by columns

options.title: --color[=WHEN]
options.description: colorize the output; WHEN can be 'always' (default if omitted), 'auto', or 'never'; more info below

options.title: -d, --directory
options.description: list directories themselves, not their contents

options.title: -d, --directory
options.description: list directories themselves, not their contents

options.title: -D, --dired
options.description: generate output designed for Emacs' dired mode

options.title: -D, --dired
options.description: generate output designed for Emacs' dired mode

options.title: -f
options.description: list all entries in directory order

options.title: -F, --classify[=WHEN]
options.description: append indicator (one of */=>@|) to entries; WHEN can be 'always' (default if omitted), 'auto', or 'never'

options.title: -F, --classify[=WHEN]
options.description: append indicator (one of */=>@|) to entries; WHEN can be 'always' (default if omitted), 'auto', or 'never'

options.title: --file-type
options.description: likewise, except do not append '*'

options.title: --format=WORD
options.description: across -x, commas -m, horizontal -x, long -l, single-column -1, verbose -l, vertical -C

options.title: --full-time
options.description: like -l --time-style=full-iso

options.title: -g
options.description: like -l, but do not list owner

options.title: --group-directories-first
options.description: group directories before files;

options.title: -G, --no-group
options.description: in a long listing, don't print group names

options.title: -G, --no-group
options.description: in a long listing, don't print group names

options.title: -h, --human-readable
options.description: with -l and -s, print sizes like 1K 234M 2G etc.

options.title: -h, --human-readable
options.description: with -l and -s, print sizes like 1K 234M 2G etc.

options.title: --si
options.description: likewise, but use powers of 1000 not 1024

options.title: -H, --dereference-command-line
options.description: follow symbolic links listed on the command line

options.title: -H, --dereference-command-line
options.description: follow symbolic links listed on the command line

options.title: --dereference-command-line-symlink-to-dir
options.description: follow each command line symbolic link

options.title: --hide=PATTERN
options.description: do not list implied entries matching shell PATTERN (overridden by -a or -A)

options.title: --hyperlink[=WHEN]
options.description: hyperlink file names; WHEN can be 'always' (default if omitted), 'auto', or 'never'

options.title: --indicator-style=WORD
options.description: append indicator with style WORD to entry names: none (default), slash (-p), file-type (--file-type), classify (-F)

options.title: -i, --inode
options.description: print the index number of each file

options.title: -i, --inode
options.description: print the index number of each file

options.title: -I, --ignore=PATTERN
options.description: do not list implied entries matching shell PATTERN

options.title: -I, --ignore=PATTERN
options.description: do not list implied entries matching shell PATTERN

options.title: -k, --kibibytes
options.description: default to 1024-byte blocks for file system usage; used only with -s and per directory totals

options.title: -k, --kibibytes
options.description: default to 1024-byte blocks for file system usage; used only with -s and per directory totals

options.title: -l
options.description: use a long listing format

options.title: -L, --dereference
options.description: when showing file information for a symbolic link, show information for the file the link references rather than for the link itself

options.title: -L, --dereference
options.description: when showing file information for a symbolic link, show information for the file the link references rather than for the link itself

options.title: -m
options.description: fill width with a comma separated list of entries

options.title: -n, --numeric-uid-gid
options.description: like -l, but list numeric user and group IDs

options.title: -n, --numeric-uid-gid
options.description: like -l, but list numeric user and group IDs

options.title: -N, --literal
options.description: print entry names without quoting

options.title: -N, --literal
options.description: print entry names without quoting

options.title: -o
options.description: like -l, but do not list group information

options.title: -p, --indicator-style=slash
options.description: append / indicator to directories

options.title: -q, --hide-control-chars
options.description: print ? instead of nongraphic characters

options.title: -q, --hide-control-chars
options.description: print ? instead of nongraphic characters

options.title: --show-control-chars
options.description: show nongraphic characters as-is (the default, unless program is 'ls' and output is a terminal)

options.title: -Q, --quote-name
options.description: enclose entry names in double quotes

options.title: -Q, --quote-name
options.description: enclose entry names in double quotes

options.title: --quoting-style=WORD
options.description: use quoting style WORD for entry names: literal, locale, shell, shell-always, shell-escape, shell-escape-always, c, escape (overrides QUOTING_STYLE environment variable)

options.title: -r, --reverse
options.description: reverse order while sorting

options.title: -r, --reverse
options.description: reverse order while sorting

options.title: -R, --recursive
options.description: list subdirectories recursively

options.title: -R, --recursive
options.description: list subdirectories recursively

options.title: -s, --size
options.description: print the allocated size of each file, in blocks

options.title: -s, --size
options.description: print the allocated size of each file, in blocks

options.title: -S
options.description: sort by file size, largest first

options.title: --sort=WORD
options.description: sort by WORD instead of name: none (-U), size (-S), time (-t), version (-v), extension (-X), width

options.title: --time=WORD
options.description: change the default of using modification times; access time (-u): atime, access, use; change time (-c): ctime, status; birth time: birth, creation;

options.title: --time-style=TIME_STYLE
options.description: time/date format with -l; see TIME_STYLE below

options.title: -t
options.description: sort by time, newest first; see --time

options.title: -T, --tabsize=COLS
options.description: assume tab stops at each COLS instead of 8

options.title: -T, --tabsize=COLS
options.description: assume tab stops at each COLS instead of 8

options.title: -u
options.description: with -lt: sort by, and show, access time; with -l: show access time and sort by name; otherwise: sort by access time, newest first

options.title: -U
options.description: do not sort; list entries in directory order

options.title: -v
options.description: natural sort of (version) numbers within text

options.title: -w, --width=COLS
options.description: set output width to COLS. 0 means no limit

options.title: -w, --width=COLS
options.description: set output width to COLS. 0 means no limit

options.title: -x
options.description: list entries by lines instead of by columns

options.title: -X
options.description: sort alphabetically by entry extension

options.title: -Z, --context
options.description: print any security context of each file

options.title: -Z, --context
options.description: print any security context of each file

options.title: --zero
options.description: end each output line with NUL, not newline
list one file per line

options.title: --help
options.description: display this help and exit

options.title: --version
options.description: output version information and exit
